abstract: Chip makers and other Silicon Valley leaders scramble to renew lobbying push for the Trans Atlantic Partnership as previous optimism vanishes; executives have said that legislation is essential to protect intellectual property across the Pacific and to keep American companies from being squeezed out of essential markets.
lead_paragraph: American chip makers say that, without the trade deal, they will be squeezed out of the growing Asian market for computer chips by competitors in countries like China.

headline.main: Chip Makers Renew Pleas to Congress for Trade Bill
headline.print_headline: Chip Makers Renew Pleas to Congress for Trade Bill

snippet: American chip makers say that, without the trade deal, they will be squeezed out of the growing Asian market for computer chips by competitors in countries like China.
